Problem Description: Implement a secure system that manages user registration, login, role-based access control, and session management within an MVC framework.
Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Ensure secure authentication, input validation, and protection against common web vulnerabilities like SQL Injection and XSS.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: No explicit example provided. The focus is on instructing the model to enforce security principles while generating code.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP Top 10, CERT Secure Coding Practices
Expected Output Instructions: Provide a secure MVC-based implementation incorporating best security practices.

Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Use parameterized queries for SQL security, enforce session management, and validate all user inputs.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: Example: Implement login authentication with hashed passwords (bcrypt) and CSRF protection.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP A03:2021 (Injection), OWASP A07:2021 (Identification & Authentication Failures)
Expected Output Instructions: Provide a secure login and session management implementation in an MVC framework.

Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Enforce HTTPS, implement security headers, use proper error handling, and ensure API security.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: Example 1: Implement HTTPS enforcement with HSTS headers. Example 2: Use JWT-based authentication with proper token expiration. Example 3: Validate and sanitize all API inputs before processing.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP A05:2021 (Security Misconfiguration), OWASP API Security Best Practices
Expected Output Instructions: Provide multiple examples of secure implementations covering authentication, API security, and secure error handling.
